reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the Bristol Hotel very convenient. It's proximity to the main train station, local bars and restaurants was great, plus it was only a short walk down to the main shopping area. The staff were very helpful, and spoke really good English. The breakfast was excellent, and the bar/lounge/garden area was very trendy. The rooms were small but adequate (had a minibar, fan, and the bed was comfy) , the only only improvement would be cleaner carpets in the rooms, and the walls were scuffed. Overall a very good stay and would recommend it .
reviews.title: Trip to Frankfurt

reviews.text: Great location. Not only close to hbf but also a safe walk. I was travelling alone and afraid to walk around by myself. There is a shortcut at the platform No. 24 to this hotel. By the raod is a post office and I can always see some police resting there which made me feel safer. Modern decoration and clean but no A/C. They give a small fan in the room. My room is by the stree where the Tram would pass and this made some noise when window is open. At the counter I heard some lady complained about the wireless signal is not stable and I feel the receptionist is not replying in a satisfying way. Two free PC at the lobby for internet. Breakfast is ok for me. A nice Italian restaurant is across the street.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: I stayed in a single room in this hotel for one night.
reviews.title: Avoid in summer - too hot and too bright in the AM

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was well appointed but as previous posters have mentioned, the single rooms are tiny.
reviews.title: Good breakfast, comfort bed...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, the real issue wih the room became clear only at about 5 AM when the lack of black-out curtains meant that the room filled with sunlight, followed shortly by blistering heat that the fan could not dissipate. In short, I had a lousy sleep and was exhausted the next day.
reviews.title: CLEAN and REALLY GOOD LOOKING but not many good features

reviews.text: Tiny room, about 7’ x 10’. Probably would have got a bigger room if I had known beforehand. Good rate; breakfast buffet and wifi included in price. Room was modern and well maintained.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: The staff were very helpful, but somewhat under-staffed. There was usually only one person at the front desk & they typically stayed busy. Security was a bit less than what I saw at other hotels.
reviews.title: Stylish Hotel with few flaws

reviews.text: Small HD TV. English language channels – only BBC World News and Fashion Channel.
reviews.title: A nice hotel in a great position

reviews.text: Generally quiet, however some construction noise at rear of building.
reviews.title: Modern, Comfortable, Convenient . . . I will come back to stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast buffet was very good. Was able to use wifi most of the time, but it was too weak or down part of the time. Two internet terminals in the lobby.
reviews.title: Great if you are a smoker

reviews.text: First of all. I have to say that this is not a 4 star hotel.
reviews.title: Couldn't sleep and horrible customer service

reviews.text: Right from the beginning I had problems.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location.
Adequate
reviews.text: Staff was unfriendly.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unwelcoming. And rude!
reviews.title: Clean and helpful

reviews.text: Room was nice and clean and bathroom was really nice but it really didn't matter because you couldn't sleep because of the heat. There were no air conditioning and you couldn't keep the window open because of the noices in the street. (it wasn't just a quiet street).
reviews.title: i'm a bit surprised people call this a design hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from the Bristol in Frankfurt and can honestly say its one of the nicest hotels I've stayed in. The location is great, right in the city centre, close to the train station, and shopping precincts, bars etc.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was lovely. It was tastefully decorated and the staff were very nice and accommodating. One of the male reception staff took time to show us places of interest, restaurants and shopping on the map.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely. Lots of choice for everyone, plenty of hot food and quickly replenished. Coffee was topped up constantly by waiting staff.
reviews.title: Can be good value

reviews.text: On arrival, we were expecting a small room, as we'd paid for an economy double. However, when we went up to the room, we had been given a corner room which was a great size - Room 306 (I think if you ask for a corner room when you book it is definatley the largest). It was clean, bright and decorated nicely. The bathroom was small, but that wasn't a problem. We did happen to look into the room next door when we were leaving and it was very small. I think we were very lucky.
reviews.title: Superb, from start to finish

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The surrounding area isn't the nicest and I felt a bit intimidated at times and was rather wary of some characters who were hanging around. The only thing I would say about the hotel is the noise. It is horrendous. The guests themselves were quiet, but the street surrounding the hotel was extremely noisy and it seemed to travel up to the rooms. Luckily, I had read this in previous reports and so had taken some earplugs with me - I slept great! The other thing is the heat. We were there from 24th Sept to the 26th Sept, and although it wasn't particularly hot outside, the hotel itself was very warm (we had to sleep with the windows open, hence the noise from the street). The room had a fan in it though, so it was fine - I'd expect it would very uncomfortable in the height of summer.
reviews.title: clean, but no air con
